Now it came to pass in the fourteenth<S>702</S> <S>6240</S> year<S>8141</S> of king<S>4428</S> Hezekiah<S>2396</S>, that Sennacherib<S>5576</S> king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S> came up<S>5927</S> against all the defenced<S>1219</S> cities<S>5892</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>, and took<S>8610</S> them.
And the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S> sent<S>7971</S> Rabshakeh<S>7262</S> from Lachish<S>3923</S> to Jerusalem<S>3389</S> unto king<S>4428</S> Hezekiah<S>2396</S> with a great<S>3515</S> army<S>2426</S>. And he stood<S>5975</S> by the conduit<S>8585</S> of the upper<S>5945</S> pool<S>1295</S> in the highway<S>4546</S> of the fuller's<S>3526</S> field<S>7704</S>.
Then came forth<S>3318</S> unto him Eliakim<S>471</S>, Hilkiah's<S>2518</S> son<S>1121</S>, which was over the house<S>1004</S>, and Shebna<S>7644</S> the scribe<S>5608</S>, and Joah<S>3098</S>, Asaph's<S>623</S> son<S>1121</S>, the recorder<S>2142</S>. <sup>scribe: or, secretary</sup>
And Rabshakeh<S>7262</S> said<S>559</S> unto them, Say<S>559</S> ye now to Hezekiah<S>2396</S>, Thus saith<S>559</S> the great<S>1419</S> king<S>4428</S>, the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>, What confidence<S>986</S> is this wherein thou trustest<S>982</S>?
I say<S>559</S>, sayest thou, (but they are but vain<S>8193</S> words<S>1697</S>) I have counsel<S>6098</S> and strength<S>1369</S> for war<S>4421</S>: now on whom dost thou trust<S>982</S>, that thou rebellest<S>4775</S> against me? <sup>vain: Heb. a word of lips</sup> <sup>I have: or, but counsel and strength are for the war</sup>
Lo, thou trustest<S>982</S> in the staff<S>4938</S> of this broken<S>7533</S> reed<S>7070</S>, on Egypt<S>4714</S>; whereon if a man<S>376</S> lean<S>5564</S>, it will go<S>935</S> into his hand<S>3709</S>, and pierce<S>5344</S> it: so is Pharaoh<S>6547</S> king<S>4428</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S> to all that trust<S>982</S> in him.
But if thou say<S>559</S> to me, We trust<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S> our God<S>430</S>: is it not he, whose high places<S>1116</S> and whose altars<S>4196</S> Hezekiah<S>2396</S> hath taken away<S>5493</S>, and said<S>559</S> to Judah<S>3063</S> and to Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, Ye shall worship<S>7812</S> before<S>6440</S> this altar<S>4196</S>?
Now therefore give pledges<S>6148</S>, I pray thee, to my master<S>113</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>, and I will give<S>5414</S> thee two thousand<S>505</S> horses<S>5483</S>, if thou be able<S>3201</S> on thy part to set<S>5414</S> riders<S>7392</S> upon them. <sup>pledges: or, hostages</sup>
How then wilt thou turn away<S>7725</S> the face<S>6440</S> of one<S>259</S> captain<S>6346</S> of the least<S>6996</S> of my master's<S>113</S> servants<S>5650</S>, and put thy trust<S>982</S> on Egypt<S>4714</S> for chariots<S>7393</S> and for horsemen<S>6571</S>?
And am I now come up<S>5927</S> without<S>1107</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> against this land<S>776</S> to destroy<S>7843</S> it? the LORD<S>3068</S> said<S>559</S> unto me, Go up<S>5927</S> against this land<S>776</S>, and destroy<S>7843</S> it.
Then said<S>559</S> Eliakim<S>471</S> and Shebna<S>7644</S> and Joah<S>3098</S> unto Rabshakeh<S>7262</S>, Speak<S>1696</S>, I pray thee, unto thy servants<S>5650</S> in the Syrian language<S>762</S>; for we understand<S>8085</S> it: and speak<S>1696</S> not to us in the Jews' language<S>3066</S>, in the ears<S>241</S> of the people<S>5971</S> that are on the wall<S>2346</S>.
But Rabshakeh<S>7262</S> said<S>559</S>, Hath my master<S>113</S> sent<S>7971</S> me to thy master<S>113</S> and to thee to speak<S>1696</S> these words<S>1697</S>? hath he not sent me to the men<S>582</S> that sit<S>3427</S> upon the wall<S>2346</S>, that they may eat<S>398</S> their own dung<S>2716</S> <S>6675</S>, and drink<S>8354</S> their own piss<S>4325</S> <S>7272</S> <S>7890</S> with you?
Then Rabshakeh<S>7262</S> stood<S>5975</S>, and cried<S>7121</S> with a loud<S>1419</S> voice<S>6963</S> in the Jews' language<S>3066</S>, and said<S>559</S>, Hear<S>8085</S> ye the words<S>1697</S> of the great<S>1419</S> king<S>4428</S>, the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>.
Thus saith<S>559</S> the king<S>4428</S>, Let not Hezekiah<S>2396</S> deceive<S>5377</S> you: for he shall not be able<S>3201</S> to deliver<S>5337</S> you.
Neither let Hezekiah<S>2396</S> make you trust<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>, saying<S>559</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S> will surely<S>5337</S> deliver<S>5337</S> us: this city<S>5892</S> shall not be delivered<S>5414</S> into the hand<S>3027</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>.
Hearken<S>8085</S> not to Hezekiah<S>2396</S>: for thus saith<S>559</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>, Make<S>6213</S> an agreement with me by a present<S>1293</S>, and come out<S>3318</S> to me: and eat<S>398</S> ye every one<S>376</S> of his vine<S>1612</S>, and every one<S>376</S> of his fig tree<S>8384</S>, and drink<S>8354</S> ye every one<S>376</S> the waters<S>4325</S> of his own cistern<S>953</S>; <sup>Make: or, Seek my favour by a present: Heb. Make with me a blessing</sup>
Until I come<S>935</S> and take you away<S>3947</S> to a land<S>776</S> like your own land<S>776</S>, a land<S>776</S> of corn<S>1715</S> and wine<S>8492</S>, a land<S>776</S> of bread<S>3899</S> and vineyards<S>3754</S>.
Beware lest Hezekiah<S>2396</S> persuade<S>5496</S> you, saying<S>559</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S> will deliver<S>5337</S> us. Hath any<S>376</S> of the gods<S>430</S> of the nations<S>1471</S> delivered<S>5337</S> his land<S>776</S> out of the hand<S>3027</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>?
Where are the gods<S>430</S> of Hamath<S>2574</S> and Arphad<S>774</S>? where are the gods<S>430</S> of Sepharvaim<S>5617</S>? and have they delivered<S>5337</S> Samaria<S>8111</S> out of my hand<S>3027</S>?
Who are they among all the gods<S>430</S> of these lands<S>776</S>, that have delivered<S>5337</S> their land<S>776</S> out of my hand<S>3027</S>, that the LORD<S>3068</S> should deliver<S>5337</S> Jerusalem<S>3389</S> out of my hand<S>3027</S>?
But they held their peace<S>2790</S>, and answered<S>6030</S> him not a word<S>1697</S>: for the king's<S>4428</S> commandment<S>4687</S> was, saying<S>559</S>, Answer<S>6030</S> him not.
Then came<S>935</S> Eliakim<S>471</S>, the son<S>1121</S> of Hilkiah<S>2518</S>, that was over the household<S>1004</S>, and Shebna<S>7644</S> the scribe<S>5608</S>, and Joah<S>3098</S>, the son<S>1121</S> of Asaph<S>623</S>, the recorder<S>2142</S>, to Hezekiah<S>2396</S> with their clothes<S>899</S> rent<S>7167</S>, and told<S>5046</S> him the words<S>1697</S> of Rabshakeh<S>7262</S>.
